item.description:
This will be a special walking tour COURTESY OF THE CAMBRIDGE HISTORICAL SOCIETY! This meetup is co-posted to Social Fun.

$5 donations are requested.

Tour meeting spot is the CCAE main entrance area, 42 Brattle St. Cambridge.

Following the tour there will be a meetup opportunity at the Legal Seafoods patio (or, if rain, Cafe Noir) at the Charles Hotel.

There is no rain date. If it rains bring an umbrella.

What does "Tory Row" mean? Ask the knowledgeable director of the Cambridge Historical Society, hosting this tour.

This tour begins at the Brattle House --which is now the CCAE (Cambridge Center for Adult Ed.)--but ends at the Hooper Lee Nichols House, the second oldest house in Cambridge, now home to the Cambridge Historical Society.

After this tour, some of us will want to go get a drink @ the Legal Seafoods patio -- ordering food there is optional. It can get a wee bit chilly there in the shade so bring an extra shirt.

Parking: if you'll be joining us at Legal Seafoods patio-- park in Harvard Sq. The parking garage at the Charles Hotel is convenient; otherwise--

SPECIAL PARKING VALIDATION will be distributed before 5:30 (not later!) at the Cambridge Historical Society headquarters, 159 Brattle Street, to allow parking there for this special tour time and day only. Or if it's more convenient, you can email info@cambridgehistory.org & get this permit forwarded to you to print out. 

Alternately please consider public transport. The closest buses from 159 Brattle St. to Harvard Sq. are the 71 or 73 but they run down parallel Mt. Auburn St.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet outside the Brattle House entrance
item.name: Special Tory Row Walking Tour-- (& Legal Sea Foods patio)
